    • Method Detail

      • getApprovalProfileId

        public static int getApprovalProfileId()
        Indicating if a call to genTokenCertificates and/or viewHardToken for non-authorized users should result in an approval request instead of an authorized denied exception.
        Returns:
        the id of the approval profile (not the name as that can be changed), or -1 if approvals shall not be used (setting is empty)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value in jaxws.approvalprofileid is set, but not an integer

      • getNoAuthorizationOnFetchUserData

        public static boolean getNoAuthorizationOnFetchUserData()
        Authorization control on the fetchUserData call, making it possible for all with a valid certificate to retrieve userData
        Returns:
        success

      • getSuspendAllCertificates

        public static boolean getSuspendAllCertificates()
        If this is true, all certificates on the old token will be put on hold. If this is false, MS SmartCard Logon certificates will not be put on hold. This is used when a temporary card is issued with ToLiMa, since MS doesn't work well with temporarily revoked smartcards.
        Returns:
        success

      • getTransactionLogEnabled

        public static boolean getTransactionLogEnabled()
        Use transaction logging for all WS calls.
        Returns:
        bool

      • getTransactionLogDateFormat

        public static String getTransactionLogDateFormat()
        Returns the date and time format that will be used for transaction logging.
        Returns:
        date

      • getTransactionLogTimeZone

        public static String getTransactionLogTimeZone()
        Returns the time zone that will be used for transaction logging.
        Returns:
        TZ

      • getTransactionLogPattern

        public static String getTransactionLogPattern()
        Returns the matching pattern that will be used for transaction logging.
        Returns:
        pattern

      • getTransactionLogOrder

        public static String getTransactionLogOrder()
        Returns the the base string that will be substituted during transaction logging.
        Returns:
        Order
